question: 1. Is talking to the girl I wish to marry haram? 2. Does my fast break by talking to the girl?
answer:
QUESTION
Assalamualeikum Mufti saab..

1) I love one girl a lot.. and i always feel like talking to her.. i'm not sure if she loves me or not.. is talking to her Haram as i was told by some Mufti In Leicester it is permissble to talk to a girl that u know u will marry... ive talked to the girl if we can get married nd she agreed..
but after some years.. so what can i do Mufti Saab?

2) Also i was told talking to her while fasting breakes my Fast? But i asked Local Maulana who is from India if my Fast Breaks when i talk to this girl nd he said my fast  doesnt break...

Mufti saab please explain this Masala.. Note that i love her.. but our parents dont know anything.. Neither me nd her never meet. We just talk on the phone..

Mufti Saab please tell me what i can do.. we've been talking for a year and some months.. is talking to her haraam? and would it break my fast?



ANSWER


Share:

Assalāmu `alaikum Warahmatullāhi Wabrakatuh,

1) It is absolutely forbidden (haram) for a person to unnecessarily interact with a non mahram (a non mahram is that woman with whom marriage is permissible).

Shariah has closed all the doors that may lead one to commit illicit sins.

This is why Allah the almighty states in the quran: "And do not even come close to fornication!" (Israa'/ verse: 32)

Why are you living in delusion? You are not sure whether the girl in question loves you or not! The best thing would be to inform your parents about the situation and to send a proposal for marriage. If the girl accepts, you will be happy and if she says no, then at least you know where you stand.

You should repent to Allah for all the times you have unlawfully spoken to the girl and make a firm intention to never commit this sin again.

2) Indulging in haram whilst fasting deprives one from attaining maximum benefit from the month of Ramadhan and causes ones spirituality level to plummet. However, talking with a non mahram does not invalidate ones fast.



And Allah Ta’āla Knows Best

Mawlana Faraz Ibn Adam,
UK
